title.narrative: TOOLS & INFO FOR BETTER PUBLIC POLICIES

description.narrative: By 2016, the government has information and tools to improve public policies aimed at the NNA in exclusion situations., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Economic And Social Policy General, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2016, policies, budgets and social programmes aimed at the NNA in poverty are improved through the generation of knowledge, evidence and information.

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers: Technical support to government cash transfer system development and expansion (design, targeting, beneficiary selection, grievance mechanism, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)
Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)
Child poverty measurement: support to routine national measurement of monetary and multidimensional child poverty
Delivery of cash transfers or voucher through new and/or parallel system (humanitarian context)

Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities policy, planning and administration

description.narrative: UNICEF contributed to the development of monitoring alerts for specific budget programmes, developed 36 studies and generated monitoring and reporting tools, in partnership with all three levels of government and civil society. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:14/12/2016
